title: How to enable GPS on Mobile device
description:
Step 1: Open your phone’s quick menu setting
Step 2: Click on the “Location” icon to turn on the GPS

Alternatively:
  Step 1: Go to Settings > Location.
  Step 2: Then turn on the slider.

title: How to enable GPS Tagging on Mobile device
description:
Step 1: Open the “Camera” app
Step 2: Open the settings of the app
Step 3: Find the setting for Location Tags
Step 4: Click the slider to turn it on.

title: Accepting Permissions for PC browser
description:
Step 1: Go to “Classifier” Tab.
Step 2: Click “Choose Files” or “Camera”.
Step 3: A pop-up should appear asking permission to use the camera or location. Press “Allow”.

title: Resetting Permissions for PC browser
description:
Step 1: Press the padlock icon on the left side of the url.
Step 2: You should see the various permissions that the site has or wants to access.
Step 3: You could choose to turn the sliders individually or click “Reset Permissions” to disable the permissions that the site has access to.

title: Accepting Permissions for Mobile device
description:
Step 1: Go to “Classifier” Tab.
Step 2: Click “Choose Files” or “Camera”.
Step 3: A pop-up should appear asking permission to use the camera or location. Press “Allow”.

Alternatively in some mobile devices:
  Step 4: Choose the option for “until i close this site” or “forever”.
  Step 5: then press “Allow”.

title: Resetting Permissions for Mobile device
description:
Step 1: Press the padlock icon on the left side of the url.
Step 2: Go to Permissions.
Step 3: You should see the various permissions that the site has or wants to access.
Step 4: You could choose to turn the sliders individually or click “Reset Permissions” to disable the permissions that the site has access to.

Alternatively, You can clear the cache of your browser to reset permissions.

*Note: This will sign you out of most sites. You won't be signed out of your Google Account*

  Step 1: Go to your browser settings.
  Step 2: Press “Privacy and Security”.
  Step 3: Click on “Clear Browsing Data”.
  Step 4: Check the option for “Cookies and site data”.
  Step 5. Press “Clear data”.
